verses.verse: And it came to pass in the month<WH2320> Nisan<WH5212>, in the twentieth<WH6242> year<WH8141> of Artaxerxes<WH783> the king<WH4428>, that wine<WH3196> was before<WH6440> him: and I took up<WH5375> the wine<WH3196>, and gave<WH5414> it unto the king<WH4428>. Now I had not been beforetime sad<WH7451> in his presence<WH6440>.

Wherefore the king<WH4428> said<WH559> unto me, Why is thy countenance<WH6440> sad<WH7451>, seeing thou art not sick<WH2470>? this is nothing else but sorrow<WH7455> of heart<WH3820>. Then I was very<WH3966> sore<WH7235> afraid<WH3372>,

And said<WH559> unto the king<WH4428>, Let the king<WH4428> live<WH2421> for ever<WH5769>: why should not my countenance<WH6440> be sad<WH3415>, when the city<WH5892>, the place<WH1004> of my fathers'<WH1> sepulchres<WH6913>, lieth waste<WH2720>, and the gates<WH8179> thereof are consumed<WH398> with fire<WH784>?
Then the king<WH4428> said<WH559> unto me, For what dost thou make request<WH1245>? So I prayed<WH6419> to the God<WH430> of heaven<WH8064>.

And I said<WH559> unto the king<WH4428>, If it please<WH2895> the king<WH4428>, and if thy servant<WH5650> have found favour<WH3190> in thy sight<WH6440>, that thou wouldest send<WH7971> me unto Judah<WH3063>, unto the city<WH5892> of my fathers'<WH1> sepulchres<WH6913>, that I may build<WH1129> it.

And the king<WH4428> said<WH559> unto me, (the queen<WH7694> also sitting<WH3427> by him<WH681>,) For how long shall thy journey<WH4109> be? and when wilt thou return<WH7725>? So it pleased<WH3190><WH6440> the king<WH4428> to send<WH7971> me; and I set<WH5414> him a time<WH2165>.

Moreover I said<WH559> unto the king<WH4428>, If it please<WH2895> the king<WH4428>, let letters<WH107> be given<WH5414> me to the governors<WH6346> beyond<WH5676> the river<WH5104>, that they may convey me over<WH5674> till I come<WH935> into Judah<WH3063>;

And a letter<WH107> unto Asaph<WH623> the keeper<WH8104> of the king's<WH4428> forest<WH6508>, that he may give<WH5414> me timber<WH6086> to make beams<WH7136> for the gates<WH8179> of the palace<WH1002> which appertained to the house<WH1004>, and for the wall<WH2346> of the city<WH5892>, and for the house<WH1004> that I shall enter into<WH935>. And the king<WH4428> granted<WH5414> me, according to the good<WH2896> hand<WH3027> of my God<WH430> upon me.

¶ Then I came<WH935> to the governors<WH6346> beyond<WH5676> the river<WH5104>, and gave<WH5414> them the king's<WH4428> letters<WH107>. Now the king<WH4428> had sent<WH7971> captains<WH8269> of the army<WH2428> and horsemen<WH6571> with me.

When Sanballat<WH5571> the Horonite<WH2772>, and Tobiah<WH2900> the servant<WH5650>, the Ammonite<WH5984>, heard<WH8085> of it, it grieved<WH3415> them exceedingly<WH7451><WH1419> that there was come<WH935> a man<WH120> to seek<WH1245> the welfare<WH2896> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>.
So I came<WH935> to Jerusalem<WH3389>, and was there three<WH7969> days<WH3117>.

¶ And I arose<WH6965> in the night<WH3915>, I and some<WH4592> few<WH4592> men<WH582> with me; neither told<WH5046> I any man<WH120> what my God<WH430> had put<WH5414> in my heart<WH3820> to do<WH6213> at Jerusalem<WH3389>: neither was there any beast<WH929> with me, save the beast<WH929> that I rode upon<WH7392>.

And I went out<WH3318> by night<WH3915> by the gate<WH8179> of the valley<WH1516>, even before<WH6440> the dragon<WH8577> well<WH5869><WH5886>, and to the dung<WH830> port<WH8179>, and viewed<WH7663><WH7665> the walls<WH2346> of Jerusalem<WH3389>, which were broken down<WH6555>, and the gates<WH8179> thereof were consumed<WH398> with fire<WH784>.
Then I went on<WH5674> to the gate<WH8179> of the fountain<WH5869>, and to the king's<WH4428> pool<WH1295>: but there was no place<WH4725> for the beast<WH929> that was under me to pass<WH5674>.

Then went I up<WH5927> in the night<WH3915> by the brook<WH5158>, and viewed<WH7663><WH7665> the wall<WH2346>, and turned back<WH7725>, and entered<WH935> by the gate<WH8179> of the valley<WH1516>, and so returned<WH7725>.

And the rulers<WH5461> knew<WH3045> not whither I went<WH1980>, or what I did<WH6213>; neither had I as yet<WH3651> told<WH5046> it to the Jews<WH3064>, nor to the priests<WH3548>, nor to the nobles<WH2715>, nor to the rulers<WH5461>, nor to the rest<WH3499> that did<WH6213> the work<WH4399>.

¶ Then said<WH559> I unto them, Ye see<WH7200> the distress<WH7451> that we are in, how Jerusalem<WH3389> lieth waste<WH2720>, and the gates<WH8179> thereof are burned<WH3341> with fire<WH784>: come<WH3212>, and let us build up<WH1129> the wall<WH2346> of Jerusalem<WH3389>, that we be no more a reproach<WH2781>.

Then I told<WH5046> them of the hand<WH3027> of my God<WH430> which was good<WH2896> upon me; as also the king's<WH4428> words<WH1697> that he had spoken<WH559> unto me. And they said<WH559>, Let us rise up<WH6965> and build<WH1129>. So they strengthened<WH2388> their hands<WH3027> for this good<WH2896> work.

But when Sanballat<WH5571> the Horonite<WH2772>, and Tobiah<WH2900> the servant<WH5650>, the Ammonite<WH5984>, and Geshem<WH1654> the Arabian<WH6163>, heard<WH8085> it, they laughed us to scorn<WH3932>, and despised<WH959> us, and said<WH559>, What is this thing<WH1697> that ye do<WH6213>? will ye rebel<WH4775> against the king<WH4428>?

Then answered<WH7725><WH1697> I them, and said<WH559> unto them, The God<WH430> of heaven<WH8064>, he will prosper<WH6743> us; therefore we his servants<WH5650> will arise<WH6965> and build<WH1129>: but ye have no portion<WH2506>, nor right<WH6666>, nor memorial<WH2146>, in Jerusalem<WH3389>.
